Minimum Requirements:

Master's degree in a related field and two years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. Grade 6E

Position Description:

The Manager, Student Financial Aid will manage the day-to-day operations of scholarship awarding and processing for the Student Financial Aid Office. Serve as primary contact for Athletics and KHEAA for scholarship awarding. Manage processes in accordance with all applicable federal, state, private, and institutional regulations, policies, and/or guidelines. Communicate with the campus community and provide subject matter expertise within the office, provide training and conduct presentations that empower colleagues to use scholarship processes to assist students. Maintain a knowledge of key institutional policies and federal and state financial aid regulations, adhere to standards that ensure quality, efficiency, compliance, and service related to the responsibilities of the team and the office. Counsel students, parents and other pertinent parties regarding application and eligibility requirements for federal, state, private and institutional aid.

    

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Provide supervision and direction to the Scholarship Awarding Team. Serve as a primary program and operations manager for aid program coordination. Represent the Scholarship Team across the university, at the request of the SFAO Director and Associate Director(s). Administer SFAO-managed institutional aid programs, including, but not limited to, management of applications, awarding, disbursement, communications, account monitoring, and problem resolution according to federal, state, and/or institutional guidelines. Collaborate with the Office of Admissions and coordinate awarding, disbursement, communication, problem resolution, and financial account monitoring for the university's admission-based scholarship programs. Train university departments, team/office members, student employees, and others as it relates to the administration, management, and compliance associated with the aid programs and activities for which the position and team are responsible. 

Compensation Will Be Commensurate To Candidate Experience.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258.

Assistance and Accommodations

Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208.

If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.

Experience Level (if available): Internship
